info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-transceiver-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions for
     monitoring transceivers in a Network Element.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2019, 2021-2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Platform & Hardware
**Paths:** 5

get.description: Top-level container for transceiver operational data
List of transceiver instance, keyed by name (collection)
List of transceiver instance, keyed by name
List of transceiver instance, keyed by name (collection)
List of transceiver instance, keyed by name

interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system.

description.description: Text description for the client physical channel

tx-laser.description: Enable (true) or disable (false) the transmit label for the channel

target-output-power.description: Target output optical power level of the optical channel(dBm)

output-frequency.description: The frequency in MHz of the individual physical channel

interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system.

output-power.description:
The output optical power of a physical channel in units
         of dBm, which may be associated with individual
         physical channels, or an aggregate of multiple physical
         channels (i.e., for the overall transceiver). For an
         aggregate, this may be a measurement from a photo detector
         or a calculation performed on the device by summing up
         all of the related individual physical channels.
         Values include the instantaneous, average, minimum, and
         maximum statistics. If average or minimum or maximum statistics are not
         supported, the target is expected to just supply the
         instant value

interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system.

input-power.description:
The input optical power of a physical channel in units
         of dBm, which may be associated with individual
         physical channels, or an aggregate of multiple physical
         channels (i.e., for the overall transceiver). For an
         aggregate, this may be a measurement from a photo detector
         or a a calculation performed on the device by summing up
         all of the related individual physical channels.
         Values include the instantaneous, average, minimum, and
         maximum statistics. If average or minimum or  maximum statistics are not
         supported, the target is expected to just supply the
         instant value

interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system.

laser-bias-current.description:
The current applied by the system to the transmit laser to
         achieve the output power. The current is expressed in mA.
         Values include the instantaneous, average, minimum, and
         maximum statistics. If average or minimum or maximum statistics are not supported,
         the target is expected to just supply the instant value

nine-micron-km.description: 9 Micron single mode fiber length in kilometers, -1 for unsupported

nine-micron.description: 9 Micron singer mode fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

fifty-micron.description: 50 Micron multi mode optical module 2 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

sixty-two-micron.description: 62.5 Micron multi mode optical module 1 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

copper.description: 50 Micron multi mode optical module 4 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

enabled.description: Turns power on/off to the transceiver

present.description: Transceiver is present on the port

identifier.description: Indicates the type of optical transceiver used on this port

connector.description: Connector type used on this port

ethernet-pmd.description: Ethernet PMD (physical medium dependent sub layer) that the transceiver supports. The SFF/QSFP MSAs have registers for this and CFP MSA has similar.

fault-condition.description: Indicates if a fault condition exists in the transceiver

sonet.description: SONET/SDH application code supported by the port

otn.description: OTN application code supported by the port

internal-temp.description: Internally measured temperature in degrees Celsius

fault-reason.description:
The error disable on the port is to inform the administrator
         when there is a port problem or error. The port can go into
         error disabled state where the traffic is not allowed in this port.

last-event-time.description:
Time of the last transceiver event.
         Events include module insertion or removal or port error

ten-gig-comp.description: Ten gig or forty gig comp code supported by the port

ge-comp.description: GE comp code supported by the port

diag-mon-impl.description:
Added list of diagnostic monitoring results
         including 'network lane - laser temperature', 'network lane - received power',
         'network lane - laser bias current', 'network lane - laser output power',
         'transceiver power voltage', 'legacy support', 'digital support', 'internal calibration',
         'external calibration', 'received average power' and 'address change'.

min.description: Minimum bit rate as percentage of nominal bit rate

max.description: Maximum bit rate as percentage of nominal bit rate

nine-micron-km.description: 9 Micron single mode fiber length in kilometers, -1 for unsupported

nine-micron.description: 9 Micron singer mode fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

fifty-micron.description: 50 Micron multi mode optical module 2 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

sixty-two-micron.description: 62.5 Micron multi mode optical module 1 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

copper.description: 50 Micron multi mode optical module 4 fiber length in meters, -1 for unsupported

interval.description: The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics are computed by the system.

voltage.description:
The voltage applied by the system to the transceiver
         to achieve the output power. The voltage is expressed in Volts.
         Values include the instantaneous, average, minimum, and
         maximum statistics. If average or minimum or maximum statistics are not supported,
         the target is expected to just supply the instant value

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

int-temp-thold.description:
The internal-temp  reports internally measured transceiver temperature as a signed
         twos compliment value in increments of 1/256 degrees Celsius.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning  as a threshold values.

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:

         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

The current applied by the system to the transmit laser to
         achieve the output power. The current is expressed in mA.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning threshold values.

The internal-temp  reports internally measured transceiver temperature as a signed
         twos compliment value in increments of 1/256 degrees Celsius.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning  as a threshold values.

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

cur-thold.description:
The current applied by the system to the transmit laser to
         achieve the output power. The current is expressed in mA.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning threshold values.

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

op-thold.description:
The output optical power of a physical channel in units
         of dBm, which may be associated with individual
         physical channels, or an aggregate of multiple physical
         channels (i.e., for the overall transceiver). For an
         aggregate, this may be a measurement from a photo detector
         or a calculation performed on the device by summing up
         all of the related individual physical channels.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning threshold values.

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

ip-thold.description:
The input optical power of a physical channel in units
         of dBm, which may be associated with individual
         physical channels, or an aggregate of multiple physical
         channels (i.e., for the overall transceiver). For an
         aggregate, this may be a measurement from a photo detector
         or a a calculation performed on the device by summing up
         all of the related individual physical channels.
         Values include the  high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning threshold values.

high-alarm.description:
Threshold values of high alarm computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-alarm.description:
Threshold values of low alarm  computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

high-warn.description:
Threshold values of high warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

low-warn.description:
Threshold values of low warning computed for internal-temp(Celsius), output power(dBM), input power(dBM),
         laser bias current(mA) and voltage(volts)

volt-thold.description:
The voltage applied by the system to the transceiver
         to achieve the output power. The voltage is expressed in Volts.
         Values include the high alarm, low alarm, high warning and
         low warning threshold values.
